title: High Carbon Sequestration from Forest Land
description: In 2022, Uganda's forest land sequestered 43.07 Mt CO2e, showcasing its significant role in carbon absorption.

title: Limited Social Protection Coverage
description: As of 2016, only 1.52% of Uganda's population was covered by social protection and labor programs, indicating a need for expansion.

title: Minimal Social Safety Net Coverage
description: In 2016, social safety net programs covered just 0.66% of Uganda's population, highlighting a gap in social welfare.

title: Low Social Safety Net Coverage in Poorest Quintile
description: Only 0.46% of the poorest quintile in Uganda was covered by social safety net programs in 2016, underscoring inequality in welfare distribution.

title: Moderate Antimalarial Treatment for Children
description: In 2019, 62.5% of children under age 5 with fever received antimalarial drugs, reflecting moderate healthcare access.

title: Low Female Genital Mutilation Prevalence
description: As of 2016, female genital mutilation prevalence in Uganda was at a low 0.3%, indicating progress in women's rights.
